subject: Management
title: Measuring Change Progress
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Measuring Change Progress.

hook.text: A transformation was declared successful. But nobody had defined what success looked like in advance.

buildup.text: Without clear metrics, change success is a matter of opinion. Opinions vary.

discovery.text: Define leading and lagging indicators before you start. Leading: adoption rate. Lagging: business impact.

twist.text: Lagging indicators are too slow for course correction. Leading indicators let you adjust in real time.

climax.text: Track both. Review weekly. Share progress publicly. Transparency on metrics builds confidence.

punchline.text: If you can't measure it, you can't manage it. Define success early.

quiz.question: Why should you define success metrics before starting a change?
options: Without clear metrics, success becomes a matter of opinion that varies widely
Metrics are unnecessary because change success is always obvious
Only lagging indicators are needed to measure change progress
